result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexandra Rose Bayuk

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates offer conveyed and accepted. Will plea to all counts, $100 fine on each count, $199 restitution to Walmart. Defendant is waiving right to attorney. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads guilty. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Court finds factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Court orders $199 restitution to Walmart, $100 fine plus costs in each count. Bail to be applied, 120 to pay remaining balance or payment plan with court.
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State reviews defendant was still seeking attorney at last appearance. Defendant does not wish to have counsel and will waive right to attorney. State to send offer letter. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No contact with Walmart.
$150.00 already posted - reinstated.

2:05 PM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Dfd's address 2321 Ogden Ave, Superior WI 54880. 
Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Dfd states she was sick and slept through alarm. State cites prior FTA's in this file. State requests additional $850 cash bail to add to previously posted $150 to make it $1000.00 total. Dfd states she does not have additional $850.00 today and states she was ill on the day she missed court. Court orders additional $500.00 cash bail and reinstates $150.00 forfeited bail New bail is $650.00 and conditions to remain. No contact with Walmart. 
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:44 AM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk not in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond. Cash bail to be applied to restitution. Court orders warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond.

1:53 PM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Quashes warrant based on appearance, questions non appearance. Was in Colorado for work. Given oral notice for court appearance back in February. Concerned about willingness to follow court orders and appear voluntarily.  State asks for reinstatement of $500 signature and asks for nominal cash of $100.
Defendant has no objection.
Court orders $150 cash and signature bond reinstated. Conditions of no contact with Walmart
Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk not in court.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond. Court orders warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond.

02:16 PM Defendant Alexandra Rose Bayuk in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant would liek to apply for PD. Defendant pleads not guilty. State requests $500 signature bond with condition of no contact with Walmart.
Court Orders $500 signature bond with condition of no contact with Walmart.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
